website_summaries.verdict: If you’re hunting for a tall, stable, sturdy, flexible, and extremely adjustable tablet stand, CTA Digital has the perfect model for your needs.
pros: Wheels smoothly glide across the floor
Adjustable height from 46 to 60 inches tall

customer_reviews.title: Pole wobbles due to poor welding
customer_reviews.text: I’m really disappointed. The pole isn’t sturdy at all. I purchased one of these several years ago for my Classroom and it is very sturdy. This one I noticed the pole ‘rocks/wiggles’. I thought it might be the bolts at the bottom, so I checked it all. Upon closer inspection it is the pole itself. Where it is welded Together. That is loose and there is no way for me to fix that. I had purchased this for my classroom as well, so I didn’t Open it & notice it until now, and it’s pass the return window.
customer_reviews.author: J Anthos

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: The gooseneck is nowhere near as flexible as expected / advertised (that third picture especially, where it looks like the writhing heads of a hydra getting ready to strike). I couldn't get 2 bends into it, and it was downright difficult to bend at all, defeating the whole purpose of a stand to hold up a tablet for someone who is too sick and weak to hold one up, much less manhandle the stand itself into position every time. Also, while seeming very heavy duty, a toddler nearly knocked it over several times. I think it'd probably be fine for people who are healthy, strong, and less erratic, but it just isn't a good fit here.
customer_reviews.author: addiK

customer_reviews.title: Ugly yes but helping my neck and shoulders while working
customer_reviews.text: Well it’s no thing of beauty, and the black cross-pieces that form the base arrived already scratched up. But since I got this so I can look straight at my iPad 12.9” v3 (latest out as of this writing)—which this stand holds even in a case using the thinnest of the 3 self-adhesive pads it comes with—it matters little. With the Apple magic keyboard, this stand, and a shoulder harness to force me into better posture I’ll be seeing a lot less of the chiropractor, which is why I invested in these 3 items recently. Too bad they didn’t hire a product designer to make it look as good as its turned out to be for my neck and back.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Very Practical
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. When assembling, make sure that you have the feet in the correct order so it doesn’t wobble... One is higher and goes over the lower one. Rolls easily but good to pull it by lower section since adjustable top can pull out if not tightened enough. Easy to carry also. Can put your smartphone in the “ business card holder” which is below the gooseneck. Easy to charge iPad Pro while secure on this stand. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Best investment during COVID
customer_reviews.text: I had to start teaching piano lessons online. The difficult task was to find a good position for my students to get a view of my hands and then zoom out to my face for me to explain what I played. This was the best and most sturdy tablet holder I could ever dream of. It holds the apple 12.9 inch tablet very well. The height adjustment is great for an downward view of my hands. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Emmeline Mireles

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: ●●update●● I have lowered my rating to 2 statts because this item although awesome for what I needed it for, broke last night. The base of the gooseneck has broken and I cannot use it for I tw ded purposes anymore. It has not fallen or been used for anything aside an iPad holder, ever. Pictures included This has been one of my best purchases! My son has Muscular dystrophy and has very limited movement and cannot sit up for long . I use this to help him reach and view his ipad. It is sturdy and very flexible but also holds its position. The wheels lock to keep it from rolling. I am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: jonstar

customer_reviews.title: NOT ADJUSTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Idea, good; follow-through, poor. The "adjustable" goose-neck is so stiff, it's impossible to manipulate it; and, the "swivel" head doesn't move at all, making it impossible to change from portrait to landscape view. I thought that, because it was new, it would loosen up; but in the intervening 10 months that hasn't happened. I've taken the top sections apart to see if they can be lubricated, and if that would help. No dice. I'm very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Roxykins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is fabulous. I love how is was made and the added attraction for me was the addition of wheels. This made the stand very movable and sturdy. The stand never tips over in whatever position you move your iPad. The goose neck is a little hard to maneuver but is manageable. I love the stand as I do not need to keep my neck down to read my iPad. As a footnote: I have the iPad Air 2 with a thick cover and it holds it beautifully. I highly recommend the CTA Digital Goose Neck Stand with wheels.
customer_reviews.author: TattooGrandma

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. I have a iPad Pro in a case that has space for the Apple pencil too. It fits well. This is sturdy enough to handle heavy taps and not have the iPad bounce or move. My cats can rub against the tablet and they don't change the tilt or view at all. The only not so great this is that it has to have at least 12 inches between the post and the wall. The legs are structured so that they cannot be adjusted to lessen the depth of the base.
customer_reviews.author: K. Meeks SC

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: From the pictures you just can't tell if this would be flimsy or not. I was pleasantly surprised that this stand is built like a workhorse! The pair of crossed metal feet are 1/4" thick solid steel and weigh a lot, and the lower central column is thick and solid. I am very pleased with how stable this is. I can put my tablet at full height and use it without any fear of tipping or any movement at all. The wheels are perfectly functional and lockable too. A nice stand!
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write reviews but I bought it because I’m a mobile hairdresser and do children’s hair. Using it to hold tablet, wireless controller while i give little guys haircuts. It’s amazing, I love it, it twists with the chair when I twist the kids, it’s on wheels. Product is heavy duty well-built but not too heavy. I give it a five star.
customer_reviews.author: Jan deRosset

customer_reviews.title: Not all the nuts fit!
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled, the stand is terrific. There is one irritating problem, and that is one of the acorn bolts simply doesnt fit, so I currently have one unattached wheel. Also, to properly tighten the stand's bolts, I need to supplement my own tools. The kit should include 2 small wrenches, of different sizes--one to hold the bolt underneath, while the other is being tightened. I'm not sure what to do about the ill-fitting bolt. Going to Ace Hardware is not what I'm feeling is an essential activity during the current crisis.
customer_reviews.author: Cat and Piano Lover

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but unstable
customer_reviews.text: Review for: Floor Stand, CTA Digital Height-Adjustable Rotating Gooseneck Stand W/Attachable Locking Wheels... Pros: pretty sturdy; iPad fit nicely with the case after adhering foam disc; wheel locking mechanism some to use with my foot, others I've used are very stiff. After adjusting the height stand feels secure. Main Con: Unstable. The top bar of the "x", where the wheels are attached, end up being higher so the stand teeters. All the wheels are the same and no height adjustment, so no way for the stand to stabilize. Other cons: screws for the wheels didn't feel completely secure. Had to tighten a few times after testing mobility (Wheeling around).
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Li

customer_reviews.title: Pro Quality - Infinite Adjustability
customer_reviews.text: Glad I chose this stand. Very nice design and high quality manufacturing. All parts fit well. Heavy steel plate base makes for great stability. The tablet I use it stays right where I place it. The spring loaded mount holds the tablet securely and leaves the cable ports and cameras unobscured for video conferencing, which is what I procured it for. Rock solid. Product came well packaged in a comparmented styrofoam carrier. No scratches or dents. This is pro quality.
customer_reviews.author: Farelegno

customer_reviews.title: Height is not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it is not telescoping which is the main reason I was sold on this thing. Also the base seems a bit bulkier than necessary. Got this for placing in front of different work out machines but since the height is not adjustable, it's literally useless to me. Edit: many YouTube videos later we figure out how to adjust it. Its not really that easy or intuitive though. I thought it could just be pushed and pulled up and down. Required some disassembly to alter. Upgraded to 2 stars from 1.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! I bought this because my baby was due while my husband was deployed. He was able to FaceTime me during labor and no one had to hold the iPad and they could roll it around if it got in the way. So amazing and definitely worth it. Now we use it for our boys ( 3 and 1 1/2) to watch Netflix and they don’t fight over who gets to hold the iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: The stand was easy to assemble and it is very steady. I thought that I would have to put additional weight on it to keep it steady but I didn't have to. I use it with the detached screen from a Microsoft surface book 2 laptop. I have had problems trying to buy mounts for this screen for my wheelchair. None that I tried were expandable to the large size, 13.1 inches, of the detached screen. The holder on this stand holds it with no problems. Even when I use the touch screen there are no problems with the stand shaking. I am more than satisfied with the quality of the stand and with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Don Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality iPad Stand.
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond pleased. It was easy to put together. I did use additional tools to tighten bolts but it is perfect. In fact I'm going to purchase a second one for my husband. The stand is heavy/durable. Yet easy to maneuver. I highly recommend. The wheels are good for the stand other reviews had me skeptical but with the use of additional tools they are good to me. This item is a must have for ant tablet user. I am using it for the iPad 12.9 2017
customer_reviews.author: Shoppingchic95

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy, met expectations
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a very solid product. Assembly was easy enough, might need a couple more tools than were supplied to get everything tight. The goose neck held well when pointing the iPad at different angles(up/down). When fully extended, if you are typing on the iPad and trying to video, you might want to hold onto it or there will be a slight oscillation. Works great in an office environment. If you are trying to video something from more that a few feet away and in a noisy area and want the person on the other end to hear you, definitely need to get a wireless headset or microphone, makes a world of difference. Great value for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product

It is great that the ipad Mini does not have to be on the bed, where it could be possibly damaged or knocked off the bed during the night, if my spouse should fall asleep while using it. The wheels are handy for moving the stand, and the stand is a perfect size for using in our bedroom.

What did not like was that Amazon packed the original box in a much larger Amazon box, without any additional packing material, so the first one came in damaged. Amazon customer service acted fast and found me a new one, and sent it to me by express 2-day shipping. They also covered the return shipping fees.
